column4: psychocats usually had good howto's luca http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/kde
heh you know how i said it was at 5%?  wel lnow it's finally at 50
i followed a psychocats guide on how to create a partition and move the home folder in it and nearly had to format the hdd. plus now i have it full of odd partition stuff
actually that looks pretty straight forward
all you do is shrink your partition, create one for home, then backup and move the home folder over, mark changes in fstab and reboot and pray
i was lucky that with a live boot i managed to reset the settings
when i restarted after fo..owing the guide it wouldn't boot
and now i dont know why i have my entire hdd full
172.29.x.x is a class B private address isn't it?
but i have installed too many services, and now finally i have file sharing set up
i have no clue as to what happened besides possibly something that could have happened from not copy pasting the instructions he said not to type out
